cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop unnecessary columns
train_df = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)
test_df = test_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)

# Fill missing values
train_df['Age'].fillna(train_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
train_df['Embarked'].fillna(train_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)
test_df['Embarked'].fillna(test_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
train_df = pd.get_dummies(train_df, drop_first=True)
test_df = pd.get_dummies(test_df, drop_first=True)

# Split features and target
X_train = train_df.drop('Survived', axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
test_df_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df)

# Train model
model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=200)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(test_df_scaled)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'], 'Survived': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop unnecessary columns
columns_to_drop = ['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']
train_df = train_df.drop(columns_to_drop, axis=1)
test_df = test_df.drop(columns_to_drop, axis=1)

# Fill missing values
imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
train_df['Age'] = imputer.fit_transform(train_df[['Age']])
test_df['Age'] = imputer.transform(test_df[['Age']])
train_df['Embarked'] = imputer.fit_transform(train_df[['Embarked']])
test_df['Embarked'] = imputer.transform(test_df[['Embarked']])

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Embarked']
train_df_encoded = pd.get_dummies(train_df, columns=categorical_features, drop_first=True)
test_df_encoded = pd.get_dummies(test_df, columns=categorical_features, drop_first=True)

# Ensure both datasets have the same columns
missing_cols = set(train_df_encoded.columns) - set(test_df_encoded.columns)
for col in missing_cols:
    test_df_encoded[col] = 0
extra_cols = set(test_df_encoded.columns) - set(train_df_encoded.columns)
for col in extra_cols:
    train_df_encoded[col] = 0

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(train_df_encoded)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df_encoded)

# Train model
model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=200)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, train_df['Survived'])

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'], 'Survived': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

test_df = test_df.drop(columns_to_drop, axis=1)

test_df['Age'] = imputer_numeric.transform(test_df[['Age']])

test_df_encoded = pd.get_dummies(test_df, columns=categorical_features, drop_first=True)

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop unnecessary columns
columns_to_drop = ['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']
train_df = train_df.drop(columns_to_drop, axis=1)
test_df = test_df.drop(columns_to_drop, axis=1)

# Fill missing values for numeric columns

test_df['Age'] = numeric_imputer.transform(test_df[['Age']])

test_df['Embarked'] = categorical_imputer.transform(test_df[['Embarked']].values.reshape(-1, 1))

test_df_encoded = pd.get_dummies(test_df, columns=categorical_features, drop_first=True)

# Scale features

X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df_encoded)

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop unnecessary columns
columns_to_drop = ['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']
train_df = train_df.drop(columns_to_drop, axis=1)
test_df = test_df.drop(columns_to_drop, axis=1)

# Fill missing values for numeric columns
train_df['Age'].fillna(train_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)

# Fill missing values for categorical columns using mode
train_df['Embarked'].fillna(train_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)
test_df['Embarked'].fillna(test_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Embarked']
train_df_encoded = pd.get_dummies(train_df, columns=categorical_features, drop_first=True)
test_df_encoded = pd.get_dummies(test_df, columns=categorical_features, drop_first=True)

# Ensure both datasets have the same columns
missing_cols = set(train_df_encoded.columns) - set(test_df_encoded.columns)
for col in missing_cols:
    test_df_encoded[col] = 0
extra_cols = set(test_df_encoded.columns) - set(train_df_encoded.columns)
for col in extra_cols:
    train_df_encoded[col] = 0

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(train_df_encoded)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df_encoded)

# Train model
model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=200)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, train_df['Survived'])

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'], 'Survived': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop unnecessary columns
columns_to_drop = ['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']
train_df = train_df.drop(columns_to_drop, axis=1)
test_df = test_df.drop(columns_to_drop, axis=1)

# Fill missing values for numeric columns
train_df['Age'].fillna(train_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)

# Fill missing values for categorical columns using mode
train_df['Embarked'].fillna(train_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)
test_df['Embarked'].fillna(test_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Embarked']
train_df_encoded = pd.get_dummies(train_df, columns=categorical_features, drop_first=True)
test_df_encoded = pd.get_dummies(test_df, columns=categorical_features, drop_first=True)

# Align columns in test_df_encoded to match train_df_encoded
common_columns = train_df_encoded.columns.intersection(test_df_encoded.columns)
test_df_encoded = test_df_encoded[common_columns]

# Add missing columns from train_df_encoded to test_df_encoded with default values of 0
missing_cols = train_df_encoded.columns.difference(test_df_encoded.columns)
for col in missing_cols:
    test_df_encoded[col] = 0

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(train_df_encoded)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df_encoded)

# Train model
model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=200)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, train_df['Survived'])

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'], 'Survived': predictio

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop unnecessary columns
columns_to_drop = ['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']
train_df = train_df.drop(columns_to_drop, axis=1)
test_df = test_df.drop(columns_to_drop, axis=1)

# Fill missing values for numeric columns
train_df['Age'].fillna(train_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)

# Fill missing values for categorical columns using mode
train_df['Embarked'].fillna(train_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)
test_df['Embarked'].fillna(test_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

# Combine unique columns from both datasets
all_columns = train_df.columns.union(test_df.columns)
train_df_encoded = train_df.reindex(columns=all_columns, fill_value=0)
test_df_encoded = test_df.reindex(columns=all_columns, fill_value=0)

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Embarked']
for feature in categorical_features:
    if feature in train_df_encoded.columns:
        train_df_encoded[feature] = pd.get_dummies(train_df_encoded[feature], drop_first=True)
    if feature in test_df_encoded.columns:
        test_df_encoded[feature] = pd.get_dummies(test_df_encoded[feature], drop_first=True)

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(train_df_encoded)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df_encoded)

# Train model
model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=200)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, train_df['Survived'])

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'], 'Survived': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv',
